did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Ithaca movie industry photograph collection, 1915-1965.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Photographs of movie actors and actresses, movie sets in Ithaca, New York, scenes from movies and various public events in Ithaca.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Ithaca, New York was a silent film center from 1910 through the 1920s. The Wharton Brothers Studio was located in Renwick (now Stewart) Park.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Photographs of movie actors and actresses, movie sets in Ithaca, New York, scenes from movies and various public events in Ithaca, collected by actress Mame (Mary L.) Hennessy. Also, personal photographs of Mary Hennessy, her family, friends and residences; letters and postcards, 1917-1964; news clippings, 1917, 1949-1961; miscellaneous manuscript and printed material, 1947-1965; and photographic negatives. Includes photographs of Irene Castle, Grace Darling, Doris Kenyon, Derwent Hall Caine, Florence Short, Marguerrete Marsh, Lillian Walker, Betty Howe, Frances White, Pearl White, Jean Sothern, Elsie Baker, Evelyn Ferris, Dick Steward, Eddie Kaw, E. Coit Albertson, and Creighton Hale.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Motion picture actors and actresses.
Motion picture studios -- New York (State) -- Ithaca.
Women in the motion picture industry.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Ithaca movie industry photograph collection, #2959. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

Series II. Letters and Postcards
Postcards to JJH from "Dick" from Mexico, Texas, Louisiana, Georgia, NYC. 6 items
Postcard from Mame to J Hennessy, on location at Saranac Lake for "The Great White Trail"
Sympathy acknowledgement card and note from Irene Castle after husbands death in aviation accident. 2 items
Letter from Bess Harris complaining of lack of mention of herself and small group for work they did in Ithaca
Letter from Arch Merrill, author of newspaper articles
Letter from Robert E. Treman thanking Mame for being hostess at Democratic Dinner at Ithaca Hotel
Mimeo. letter and coupon stub from Community Players
Letter from James Farley, enclosing picture of him and grandson with Pope Paul VI

"The Cornell Widow"

Script of play "Prim and Promiscuous", probably for benefit of Policemen's Ball. Spoof on "Pride and Prejudice."
